page.title: 02Local History.
page.content: In our area we have a few historic remains.One is a cromlech and it is about 3,500 years old.Three supporters still stand erect but the capstone has slipped.it measures 8 by 7 and is 2"thick.In the field to the north of the cromlech is a fine flat stone called Bwrdd Arthur.The next historic remain is an iron age hillfort and it is a fairly perfect enclosure with a ditch.To the south west stands what appears to be the remains of an annex.The entrance is also in the south west corner.At Bryn Cywyn is a rectangular enclosure of almost a quarter of an acre with a simple entrance on the eastern bank,surrounded by a continuous ditch of iron age or Roman period.
